Floating Chocolate Bars - A series of chocolate bars that float on the river, each one shaped like a different animal. Visitors can purchase these chocolate bars and feed them to the animals, such as a chocolate giraffe or a chocolate elephant. (Confidence Score: 0.8)

Chocolate Fountain Boats - A boat ride that takes visitors through the river, while they float on a chocolate fountain. The fountain will be filled with different types of chocolate, such as milk chocolate, dark chocolate, and white chocolate. Visitors can use chocolate dipping sticks to dip fruits, marshmallows, or other treats into the fountain. (Confidence Score: 0.9)

Chocolate Tasting Experience - A unique experience where visitors can taste different types of chocolate and learn about the history and production process of chocolate. The experience will include a chocolate tasting room with different stations, each one featuring a different type of chocolate. Visitors can learn about the different flavors, textures, and aromas of chocolate and even create their own custom chocolate blend. (Confidence Score: 0.9)

Chocolate Sculpture Garden - A garden filled with chocolate sculptures of famous landmarks, monuments, and buildings. The sculptures will be made from edible chocolate and visitors can purchase a map to follow as they explore the garden and learn about the different sculptures. (Confidence Score: 0.8)

Chocolate Waterfall - A waterfall made entirely of chocolate, where visitors can walk through and enjoy the sweet treat. The waterfall will be shaped like a chocolate river and will have different sections with different types of chocolate, such as milk chocolate, dark chocolate, and white chocolate. Visitors can also purchase chocolate souvenirs at the end of their visit. (Confidence Score: 0.9)
